positions.title: Founder & Director
positions.description:
Former positions:

Professor in Acute Care, Institute of Nursing & Master in Advanced Studies, ZHAW University, Winterthur, CH

Lecturer, Gerontology and Pediatric Nursing, Master in Advanced Studies, ZHAW University, Winterthur, CH

Course Director of Nursing Research, Course Director of  Research Transfer in the Program Master of Science in Nursing, ZHAW University, Winterthur, CH 

Dean of the Post Graduate (Advanced Nursing Program) at the University Hospital, Bern;
Research Fellow at the Head Office kn the Nursing and Emergency Department, University Hospital, Bern

Project Director, Development of a Post-Graduate Program for Nurse Educators at the Center for Higher Education, Bern

Associate Dean & Lecturer in the Post Graduate Nursing Program at the University Hospital School, Bern, CH

Visiting Scholar, USA. Studies in History & Cultural Sciences, Public Health, Managed Care/Clinical Pathways, Health Psychology, Nursing Theory and Research: University of Pittsburgh. Clinical Assessment: Duquesne University (PA). 

Program Director & Associate Dean, Post Graduate Nursing Program at the University Hospital School, Bern, CH

Lecturer, Program Director & Associate Dean at the Nursing School Biel, CH

Staff nurse on medical, surgical, orthopedic and gynaecologic wards

educations.schoolName: University of Applied Sciences, Institute for Psychology, Zurich, Switzerland

allData.headline: Founder & Director Pflege PBS, Professor in Nursing Diagnostics & former ACENDIO President
allData.summary:
Maria Müller-Staub was Professor Adjunct in Nursing Diagnostics at Hanze University, Nursing Department, in Groningen (NL). Formerly, she was Full Professor  in Acute Care at the Institute for Nursing Science, ZHAW University, Winterthur and Program Director of nursing research and research transfer courses.
She is an excellent nurse educator at graduate levels in nursing and supervisor of doctoral students. As an expert in curriculum development, she was Dean of a nursing school offering advanced nursing programs. 

Maria Müller-Staub is Founder & Director of Pflege PBS (Nurse Consulting, Teaching, & Research), Wil, Switzerland (CH). She implements nursing language related to the classifications of nursing diagnoses, interventions and outcomes (NANDA-I, NIC & NOC) in Swiss and German hospitals and nursing education programs. 

Her main focus in research and education is evidence-based practice based on nursing diagnostics, clinical decision making and critical thinking. She leads research and practice projects on standards for nursing documentation, nursing care quality and Clinical Information Systems (CIS). 

The instrument Quality of Diagnoses, Interventions and Outcomes (Q-DIO) was developed and tested to measure the quality of the nursing process as an audit tool. The Q-DIO was translated and tested in the languages German, English, Brazilian, Portugese, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Slovenian, French and Bahasa Indonesian. 

Maria Müller-Staub has 356 publications and presented more than 200 oral papers. She was a lecturer in national and international nursing programs.

See further CV information and list of publications at:
https://www.pflege-pbs.ch
